turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello there.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, hello. Can you hear me OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, I can hear you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, great. <UNIN/>. I am, yes. Nice to see you here, Oscar. Um, how can I help you this afternoon?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Are you the doctor?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I'm, contacting you because I've been, quite short of breath lately.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Do you want to tell me a bit more about it? When did it all start?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, well it seems to have been, slowly getting worse over the last couple of weeks.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, now it's, become quite troublesome, <UNSURE>in</UNSURE> the last few days.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I kind of, normally I can walk to the shops, without a problem but, now I'm having to sort of sit down and catch my breath. And I'm <UNSURE>really</UNSURE> starting to get a bit breathless, just about the house.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And uh, it's got me kind of worried, don't really know what's going on.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. OK. Is there anything you're particularly worried about?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, well, I've, I've uh, I've got um, heart failure.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I was told that, uh, a while ago.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, and I got a bit breathless when I was first diagnosed, and put on some <UNSURE>medicine</UNSURE> that, that um, that helped, but I'm a bit worried it's just getting worse.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. So you mentioned you're feeling, uh, short of breath for the last couple of weeks, but mainly the last couple of days it's got a bit worse.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, uh, and you're now feeling more breathless on kind of minimal, minimal exertion you mentioned. Um, have you noticed any other symptoms at all, uh, uh, with your breath? So, for example, any pain in your chest?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No pain in my chest.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And have you found yourself coughing, coughing at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I've got a bit of a dry cough, but it's not too troublesome.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. OK. And how's your general health otherwise? Are you feeling uh, weak, lethargic?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I'm feeling a little run-down, um, but otherwise, otherwise pretty normal.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I've noticed my ankles have got a bit bigger.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And what do you mean by that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, it's just like, it's sort of swollen up a bit.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, is that, is that both <UNIN/>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Kind of <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. Um, yeah, both ankles. Yeah, it's a bit embarrassing.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Both ankles?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Uh, I can imagine, yeah. Um, and again, <UNIN/> over how long has this, have you noticed this for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I kind of noticed it the last few days.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Past few days, OK. And is this something that you've had before, in the past?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I think my ankles did swell up a bit last time, the heart failure was a problem.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. OK. Um, fine. OK. So, um, just to really recap, uh, so you're really, in the last couple of weeks, uh, you've been feeling breathless, uh, but worse in the last couple of days. You mentioned you had a bit of a dry cough.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and some swelling in your ankles. Um, reporting no chest pain. Um, and, and have you had any, have you any, have you noticed your heartbeat racing at all? So, palpitations or skipped heartbeat?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, not really.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And any temperatures or fevers?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And how about your appetite? Are you eating and drinking OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, I, <UNIN/>, <UNSURE>I'm</UNSURE>, that's fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And your waterworks? Are you passing urine OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, <UNSURE>but</UNSURE> yeah. I usually pee a lot, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, ever <UNSURE>since</UNSURE> the drugs <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sure, OK. Alright. Um, fine. So, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> your uh, your past medical history. You mentioned heart failure. Any, any other medical history I should be aware of?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, well I was told I had like a, they called it like a small heart attack.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: About, five years ago. Um, I uh, I had, I, I had like <UNSURE>some</UNSURE> chest pain and, they took me into hospital.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And um, they, uh, but then I just got better.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And when, when you say a small heart attack, did they give you a name, for what happened, a, a name of a diagnosis?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I can't remember. They just called it something a <UNIN/>, uh, something like that, a small heart attack.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: It's more hard to say. OK. Was it like angina or, um,

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no they, they said that it, uh, it seemed, it was like, more than angina.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, uh, but um, I didn't, but I only had to stay in hospital for a few days, and, uh.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And yeah, I've been OK since then.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You've been OK since then. OK, alright. So, apart from the uh, the heart, the heart problems, the heart failure, any other problems I should be aware of?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, I think I'm otherwise, I'm OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Um, do you take any regular medications, apart from your <UNIN/> diuretics that you're taking? And do you know which ones?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Uh</UNSURE>, yeah, I take something called Furosemide.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. Do you know which dose you're taking?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I can't remember, I'm sorry doctor. I have to check.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: That's OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No problems. Um,

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Any other medications?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah. I take Aspirin.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>And uh, Bisoprolol</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: The Metoprolol, was it?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Or?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, <UNSURE>Bisoprolol</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sorry, the connection's not very good. OK. Thank you, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>And a thousand</UNSURE>, OK. Alright. Any allergies at all? Any medications?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Uh</UNSURE>, no, no allergies.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And is there anything in the family that's, uh, that, that's uh, that's important for me to know? Any family history of medical problems, heart problems, lung problems?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh <UNIN/>, my, my father died of a, uh, of a heart attack.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear that. And, um, how old was your father when he passed away?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, he was, um, early sixties.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Early sixties, OK. Alright. Anything else I should be aware of?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, my mother had osteoporosis.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is your mother still with us?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, she's still living.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. Um, and socially, sir, just tell me a bit more about your situation at home. Who lives at home with you?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I live on my own. Well, I got two cats.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You've got two cats. OK, great. Do they have names?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: They're my family. Uh, they're, they're called, um, they're called, Polly and Tim.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, so it's just you and your cats. And um, in terms of day to day, are you working at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I work part-time as, a, uh, lorry driver.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And how is that? Is that quite stressful, long hours?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, it's OK. Um, I uh, yeah <UNIN/>, when I'm working it's pretty exhausting.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I guess I'm a bit worried, that if I get sick I won't, if I get more sick then, I won't be able to work properly.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah, that's certainly a consideration, isn't it? So let's, let's try and get you better soon, so it doesn't have any um, impact on your, on your job.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>No</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, and do you find yourself doing a lot of anti-social hours? Do you <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>, do you do a lot of night driving, weekend driving?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh no, I <UNIN/>, I <UNIN/>, I, I only take shifts during the day, I don't like working at night.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. And what about smoking and alcohol? So, 'cause <UNIN/> that can sometimes be very important when it comes to heart problems. Do you, do you smoke at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not any more.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: So, you used to smoke?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And how many did you smoke a day, on average?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ooh it was about, about a pack a day, back in the day.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and how many, how many years was that for?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh that was, oof, good twenty five years.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And what about the stopping? That must have been difficult for you. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> stopping. Um, and what, what about alcohol?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I don't drink alcohol.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Do you do much in the way of exercise, sir?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, I try and walk to the shops, at least once a day.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, but uh, that's about it, I've. Yeah, I don't, I don't go running like I used to when i was young.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right, OK. And certainly now your symptoms, you, you're, you said you're feeling more breathless even walking to the <UNIN/> uh, to the shop, she said.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, right. Ohh um, based on your, based on you history, and having listened to your story, I, I wonder whether you've had a flare-up of your heart failure, sir. Um,

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Which can sometimes happen. Um, um, and uh,

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mmm.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>That</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: It's <UNIN/>. So, it seems like your heart's not pumping as well as it should be. Um, and obviously having diagnosed with heart failure, there's obviously

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: What's going <UNSURE>on</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, that's the first thing that comes to my mind. Um, now there's a couple of options <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> move forward. Um,

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mmm.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Given that you're otherwise well at the moment, and having examined you, your chest, and your saturations and blood pressure are all OK,

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'm quite happy to increase your dose of Furosemide. Maybe, rather than one tablet a day, we can do two tablets a day, for the first few days.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and see, and see how you're getting on.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK. If you think that'll be better.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Uh</UNSURE>,

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I think, I think, it's, <UNIN/> it's, it's definitely worth treating your symptoms. But what we should also think about is maybe doing a couple of other tests, like a blood test, and maybe an echocardiogram of your heart, to see how well your heart's pumping.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is that something you've had <UNSURE>before</UNSURE>? Yeah, so um, an <UNIN/>, it's a, it's a general scan of your heart. You might have had this done before, when you were diagnosed. And it's just to get a good

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: What does that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh yes, <UNSURE>I remember now</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Sorry?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, I remember now. <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You remember that. OK, fine. That's something I can organize for you today. And, and that might take a week or two weeks for that to be organized. But, I think certainly in the meantime, let's, um,

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Let's, let's get a blood test done. We can check your um, you know your full blood count, look for signs of anemia. We can have a check of your kidney function.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and we can definitely increase your um, your Furosemide, uh, to you know, one tablet twice a day.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: But I really like, would like you to come back and see me in about a week's time, see how you're getting on. That sound reasonable?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I think that sounds like a good plan.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And of course, in the meantime if you are getting more unwell, feel like you're getting more breathless, or you're having any other symptoms like chest pain, or palpitations or dizziness, then, uh, you know <UNIN/> I want you to give me a call sooner than that, and we can have a chat on the phone as well.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK. I'll see <UNSURE>how</UNSURE> I get on.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK? Do you have any questions for me?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, <UNSURE>I</UNSURE> think that's all pretty clear. Thank you very much Doctor.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Great, and then well I wish you all the best! Have a good day. <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> OK. Thank you.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>. See you soon.
